lines.text: Welcome everyone. I am your dam guide, Arnie. Now I'm about to take you through a fully funtional power plant, so please, no one wander off the dam tour and please take all the dam pictures you want. Now are there any dam questions?
Yeah, where can I get some damn bait?

[to his kids, played by the fourth different set of actors in as many "Vacation" movies]
You guys are growing up so fast, I hardly recognize you anymore!
Eddie, has anyone ever told you you're bad luck?
Those were my mother's dying words. But I guess if your body's covered in third degree burns, and your foot's caught in a bear trap, you tend to start talkin' crazy.
[Marty points to the Table Limit Sign $10 minimum]
Come on, Griswold, You think that sign is there to hold the table down?
What can I do with five dollars?
Gee, I don't know. Buy a bullet and rent a gun?
Why don't you give me half the money your were gonna to bet, then we'll go out back, I'll kick you in the nuts, and we'll call it a day!
That's it Clark... show him who's boss. It's people like you who come here and blow the family nest egg that built this town... not this pretty boy!

[trying to get Clark's attention]
Dad?
In a minute Russ.
[talking to Cousin Eddie]
You see the promise of material possesions can often blind one to...
[Rusty taps Clark on the arm]
What is it, Russ?
Those four cars over there... they're mine.

[surprised]
What do you mean they're... they're yours?
Yeah.

[suspiciously]
Where did they come from, Russ?
Well, four slot machines and I won four cars. You know, I put a dollar in, I got a car. I put a dollar in, I got a car. I put a dollar in, I got a car. I put a dollar in, I got a car.
I-I-I, okay, I think I get it. Give me the keys, please.
[Rusty hands Clark all the car keys]
Okay! Ellen you drive the red one,
[hands car keys to Ellen]
you take the white one,
[hands car keys to Audrey]
you take the Mustang,
[hands car keys to Rusty]
and I'll take that big, black thing over there. After you, Mr. Pappagiorgio!
Oh yeah, Yuban Coffee. You know you can sprinkle that stuff on anything? Ice cream, mashed potatoes, or just eat it right out of the can for a quick pick me up.

[Clark and Ellen have found Audrey dancing at the Club Aereola]
Audrey! What are you doing? Ten years of tap dancing lessons and this is the way you repay us?
What? You told me to get a summer job!
I haven't seen a beatin' like that since somebody stuck a banana in my pants and turned a monkey loose.
Thanks for the pick me up Eddie.
Holy crap, Wayne Newton's hittin' on mom!
It's all part of the act, Russ.
So I says to him, I said "Get your own monkey!"
Where the hell is the damn dam tour?
Ellen, I've always been a moral man. But my resolve is melting in the light of your blinding smile.
Um, maybe you're just hungry, would you like some more pasta?
Welcome to the Mirage. May I have your credit card, please?
Yes, indeedy. Clark W. Griswold, four.
You know, we have an excellent dry cleaning service here, if you're so inclined.
Oh, uh? it's? it's a bbbirthmark.

Uh-huh. Now in order to get to your rooms, you're going to have to go this way through the casino, veer to the left. Take a sharp right at the first giant palm tree. You'll see a group of blackjack tables. Not baccarat, not craps, blackjack. Keep going, then wind around to your left. If you get to the pool, you've gone too far, back up and take another right. You'll see a bank of elevators. Those aren't your elevators, stay away from them. But keep going, you'll see another bank of elevators, the gold elevators, those are yours. Take them up to the tenth floor, take a right at the end of the hall and you'll find your room. Any questions?
Uh-uh-uh no not really. Russ!
Yeah, dad.
Oh, there you are. Didja get that?
I don't care if you ruined my life. I love you!

[looking around Hoover Damn in awe]
Oh, I love electricity. Eddie says we're gonna get some soon.
Eddie, I gambled away more money than you'll ever understand.
Try me.

[whispering]
Twenty-two thousand eight hundred dollars.

[shouting]
Oh God! Oh God! Oh my shhhhooddd! Oh God! Oh my God!
Woo hoo... Big bet for a BIG man... Sure you don't want to save a few bucks for the buffet?
OH MY GOD... it's Wayne Newton! Can I be your bodyguard? I'd die for ya.
[stares at Wayne and pats his head]

[inside the sleezy casino]
I need to go somewhere a man can think.
Oh, oh I wouldn't do that here Clark, the stalls are awefully dirty and they're backed up all the time.
No, Eddie, I need to be alone.
Oh, oh I see, ya want me to go with ya?
Allright,come on.
Well, I hope you kids have learned something about the dangers of gambling.

[inspecting Rusty's fake ID / quizzing him on it]
No, uh, corrective lenses tonight?
No, I do not require them.
Did you come to Las Vegas to be a showgirl?
No. I'm on vacation with my parents.

[rowdy]
Hard to believe we're related, right?

[running up to Dean, the Pit Boss]
Hey! Have you seen this person?
[holds up picture of Rusty]

[examining the picture]
Hm. Mr. Pappagiorgio, yeah. Lanai Six.
My son.

[confused]
Mr. Pappagiorgio?

[confused as well; to Ellen]
Let's go.
[they run off]

[catching onto what's going on]
Oh boy, oh boy.
[picks up phone to call security]

[watching as Wayne Newton brings Ellen up on stage with him]
Well, I think we know who sent the dress.

[Lounging by a pool with Audrey, looking at hunky guys]
These boys ain't much to talk to, but if you need a night away from your cat, they're more than fine.

[Audrey's climbing to the top of Vegas Vic]
Audrey! What're you doing up there?
I'm starting my vacation!
[dances]
She's gonna break a lot of heart.
She's gonna break something!

[as they watch Vicki pole dance]
Don't think unnatural thoughts about your cousin, Russ.

[Clark and Ellen have found Rusty in the hot tub]
Oh my Lord... Rusty!
Oh, you must be lost. This is Mr. Pappagiorgio.
His name is not Pappagiorgio! His name is Rusty Griswold and he's a C+ student! Now out of the pool, let's go young man! Now!
[Clark yanks Rusty out of the hot tub]

[about Las Vegas]
Isn't there legalized prostitution?

[to Clark, about Ellen]
Very special lady.
That's why I entered into the sacred bond of marriage with her.
It is a blazer out there. You're lucky you got air conditioning in here like mother nature intended.
Can't you just wrap me up in a blanket and roll me across the bed again?
[Clark is playing blackjack]
Twenty. I'll stay.

[flips over his card]
Wha...? It's twenty. It's a push!
I didn't lose!
That's it, Griswold! You are freakin dead!
I've lost three hundred dollars in fifteen minutes?
[Eddie, having taken a sip of beer, chokes and spits it out]
Come on, Clark, the night is young... they're giving away free hot sandwiches at the blood bank.
Every time I belch, the plate shifts and my legs give out. But man, what a view.
Hey, you wanna dance up here?
No, I don't think so.
Audrey, honey, let me tell you something that I've learned. In this world you're either up on the stage in the spotlight, or down in the pit serving drinks. So have some fun.
Where in the hell is the damn dam tour?
*Ellen switches off the TV* Hard six coming out.
What?
Hit me. *Ellen slaps him in the dark*
Ow.
Now, aren't you a little slice of pie?
How is your chicken? Mine is dry as hell.
Mine's dry as hell too.
If you want to hang out with cousin Vicki tonight, I'll give you my beeper number.
Really? That would be great!
